actions.recommendation: Lockdown has been a stressful time for many and has had a negative impact on many people's lifestyles. Try to make one small change at a time with regards to your lifestyle (diet, alcohol, caffeine, exercise) and slowly but surely you will start to turn things around.
Please visit a dentist to address your dental issues. Dental issues can lead to general inflammation in the body and even be a risk factor for heart disease if not addressed.
Supplement with vitamin D 3 5000iu daily and spend some time in the sun without burning. Retest level in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level of 50ng/ml.
Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily, avoid trans fats and refined carbohydrates, increase exercise and manage stress. Repeat blood after 3 months.
You can choose to turn this around and hopefully now that the pandemic is easing slightly and the weather is improving, you will feel more motivated to make healthy choices.
Most of your concerns currently relate to lifestyle changes that have occured during lockdown.
Tanya, a very low vitamin D level was found in your blood results.
A slightly raised cholesterol level was found in your blood results.
